raw:
```json
{
  "file": "Login.aspx",
  "vulnerabilities": [
    {
      "title": "Insecure Password Storage",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-256",
      "description": "The code does not specify how passwords are stored. If passwords are stored in plaintext or using weak hashing algorithms, this poses a significant security risk.",
      "line_numbers": [1],
      "recommendation": "Ensure that passwords are hashed using a strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt, Argon2) before storing them in the database."
    },
    {
      "title": "Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-79",
      "description": "The FailureText control is used to display error messages. If these messages are not properly sanitized, they could be exploited for XSS attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [1],
      "recommendation": "Sanitize all user input and output to prevent XSS. Use built-in encoding functions to encode output before rendering it in the browser."
    },
    {
      "title": "Lack of Account Lockout Mechanism",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-307",
      "description": "The login form does not implement an account lockout mechanism after a certain number of failed login attempts, making it vulnerable to brute-force attacks.",
      "line_numbers": [1],
      "recommendation": "Implement an account lockout mechanism that temporarily disables the account after a specified number of failed login attempts."
    },
    {
      "title": "Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR)",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-639",
      "description": "If the application does not properly validate user permissions when accessing resources, it may allow unauthorized access to user accounts.",
      "line_numbers": [1],
      "recommendation": "Implement proper authorization checks to ensure that users can only access their own accounts and resources."
    }
  ]
}
```
